properties.name: addPersons
properties.description: Whether to show the "+ Add Person" buttons in the pedigree when a person is missing

properties.name: extend
properties.description: Whether to show the button to extend the pedigree from this couple

properties.name: extended
properties.description: Whether the pedigree is currently extended from this couple

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether to show the loading icon

methods.name: _extendEvent
methods.description: Fired when the extend button is clicked.

methods.name: _collapseEvent
methods.description: Fired when the collapse button is clicked.

methods.name: _eventDetail
methods.description: Gather the event detail information

attributes.name: add-persons
attributes.description: Whether to show the "+ Add Person" buttons in the pedigree when a person is missing

attributes.name: extend
attributes.description: Whether to show the button to extend the pedigree from this couple

attributes.name: extended
attributes.description: Whether the pedigree is currently extended from this couple

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Whether to show the loading icon

properties.name: spouseId
properties.description:
ID of the root person's spouse, if known. When not specified, the
API will automatically choose a spouse. You may set this property
to specify which spouse will be loaded.

properties.name: addPersons
properties.description: Whether to show the "+ Add Person" buttons in the pedigree when a person is missing

properties.name: rootGroup
properties.description:
Whether this is the root group. The root group displays the root
couple and two additional generations. Non-root groups don't display
the root couple (they're already displayed) and just display the
two additional generatiosn.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Whether this group of ancestors is loading

properties.name: _nextGroup
properties.description: Pointer to the next ancestor group

methods.name: collapse
methods.description: Collapse (remove) this portion of the pedigree.

methods.name: positionWithCouple
methods.description:
Position the group to be in line with the given coordinates of the
couple group that was extended.

params.name: left
params.description: Left position of the couple, in pixels

params.name: top
params.description:
Top position of the couple, in pixels. The group 
will be vertically centered with this position.

methods.name: _displayCouples
methods.description: Create couple elements and add them to the DOM.

methods.name: _displayCouple
methods.description:
Calculate whether a couple group should be displayed.
They are displayed when either the husband or wife is present
or if addPersons is true and their child is present.

methods.name: _coupleHasChild
methods.description:
Calculate whether the couple has a child. This is used when calculating
whether a particular couple group should be shown. When adding persons,
we want to show empty couples so that parents can be added. This method
is called on those empty couples so that we can check whether there is
a child that those parents belong to. Otherwise we don't want ot show
the couple because we can't add parents to a person that doesn't exist.

methods.name: _getCouplesChild
methods.description: Get a couple's child

methods.name: _calculateChildCoupleNumber
methods.description: Calculate the child's couple number of another couple

methods.name: _extendCouple
methods.description: Extend the pedigree from the given couple.

methods.name: _collapseCouple
methods.description: Collapse the pedigree at the given couple.

methods.name: _calculateAbsoluteCouplePosition
methods.description:
Couple events contain information about the position of
the couple element. That position is used to position the new
ancestor group. However that position is relative to this couple
group so here we modify the position to be relative to the
pedigree container by adding this element's position to the 
couple element's position.

methods.name: _clearCouples
methods.description:
Remove persons from the couple config object and
clear couples from the DOM.

methods.name: _addPerson
methods.description: Emit the add-person event

methods.name: _showLine
methods.description: Show a line.

methods.name: _hideLines
methods.description:
Hide all lines. The default display value is none (via CSS) so here
we just clear the value we set when showing the line.

methods.name: _drawLines
methods.description:
Draw lines but don't modify their display. Default display is none.
We will decide later whether they need to be shown.

methods.name: _drawStartLine
methods.description:
Draw the beginning lines for a non-root group. They are the lines that
stretch out to the left to connect to the couple where the pedigree
was expanded.

methods.name: _drawOtherLine
methods.description:
Draw a path that connects two couples. Lines are drawn starting with a
couple group to the left. The line proceeds vertically up or down then
turns to the right and connects horizontally to the left side of the
final couple group.

params.name: num
params.description:
Line number. Line numbers are associated with the
couple group on the right hat the path connects to horizontally.

params.name: startX
params.description:
The starting x coordinate for the vertical 
portion of the line.

params.name: startY
params.description:
The starting y coordinate for the vertical
portion of the line.

params.name: vertical
params.description: The length of the vertical portion of the line.

params.name: horizontal
params.description: The length of the horizontal portion of the line.

methods.name: _drawLine
methods.description: Create a path element and contruct it's path

methods.name: _lineId
methods.description: Given a line number, return it's id

attributes.name: spouse-id
attributes.description:
ID of the root person's spouse, if known. When not specified, the
API will automatically choose a spouse. You may set this property
to specify which spouse will be loaded.

attributes.name: add-persons
attributes.description: Whether to show the "+ Add Person" buttons in the pedigree when a person is missing

attributes.name: root-group
attributes.description:
Whether this is the root group. The root group displays the root
couple and two additional generations. Non-root groups don't display
the root couple (they're already displayed) and just display the
two additional generatiosn.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Whether this group of ancestors is loading

elements.description:
Display a FamilySearch person's pedigree.

    <fs-pedigree person-id="PPPP-PPP"></fs-pedigree>

properties.name: spouseId
properties.description:
ID of the root person's spouse, if known. When not specified, the
API will automatically choose a spouse. You may set this property
to specify which spouse will be loaded.

properties.name: addPersons
properties.description: Whether to show the "+ Add Person" buttons in the pedigree when a person is missing

methods.name: _collapseTo
methods.description: Collapse to the given level by removing all level greater than it.

methods.name: _removeLevels
methods.description: Remove groups from any level greater than or equal to the given level.

elements.name: FsPedigree

attributes.name: spouse-id
attributes.description:
ID of the root person's spouse, if known. When not specified, the
API will automatically choose a spouse. You may set this property
to specify which spouse will be loaded.

attributes.description: Whether to show the "+ Add Person" buttons in the pedigree when a person is missing
